glsa.title: Clam AntiVirus: Denial of Service vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: Clam AntiVirus is vulnerable to a Denial of Service attack when processing certain Quantum archives.

background.p: Clam AntiVirus is a GPL anti-virus toolkit, designed for integration with mail servers to perform attachment scanning. Clam AntiVirus also provides a command line scanner and a tool for fetching updates of the virus database.

description.p: Andrew Toller and Stefan Kanthak discovered that a flaw in libmspack's Quantum archive decompressor renders Clam AntiVirus vulnerable to a Denial of Service attack.

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a Denial of Service by sending a specially crafted Quantum archive to the server.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
